page.title: 15A walk to Harperley Park
page.content: Harperley Park is a large area of meadowland surrounded by mainly deciduous trees of all kinds.As the approach roads are private you have to walk along public footpaths through fields to reach the wood and the river which is the Wear beyond it. We walked through the three fields, one of Barley, one of wheat and one of rough grazing land.Also we saw some animals.Part of the woodland meadow had been turned into a corn field.Near the rough grazing field there was a beck or small stream.Beside the beck there is a small cottage with three rooms. The fields are fenced and these are crossed by means of a style or gate.Larks were flying up from one of the fields. We passed by a small wood of oak, sycamore and rowan trees.
